Description: Clay seven-sided prism with cuneiform inscription recording Esarhaddon's restoration of Babylon; the symbols on its top and bottom ends have been taken to represent the king's name; broken; impressions in both ends; column i when complete had 48 ll.
Bibliographic references: Pinches, CT 44 / Cuneiform Texts from Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum: Miscellaneous Texts (plates 2-4, no. 3) (copy)
Borger R 1956a / Die Inschriften Asarhaddons Koenigs von Assyrien (pp. 10-29) (as Rezension A)
Luckenbill D D 1927a / Historical records of Assyria from Sargon to the end (pp. 242 and 244-249) (paragraphs 639 and 647-659)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
Acquisition notes: Acquired by the British Museum as a result of Budge's second mission to Egypt and Mesopotamia in 1887-1888; the mission was intended to investigate the "leakage" of tablets from sites supposedly guarded on behalf of the British Museum. Further notes on acquisition and bibliographic references relating to acquisition in catalogue introduction pp.xv-xvii.
